intro: Gardenia tchibangensis, commonly known as the Cameroon gardenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Cameroon and Nigeria. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant, white flowers. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
